hints.title: Localization Scale Trade-offs
hints.content:
5139: :label: rem-rho-tradeoffs
5140: 
5141: **Small ρ** (hyper-local, $\rho \ll \text{diam}(\mathcal{X})$):
5142: - ✓ **Pros**: Sharp localization, better low-order derivative bounds (m < 2d), geometric adaptation
5143: - ✗ **Cons**: High-order derivatives explode (m > 2d), numerical stiffness, small time steps for high-order integrators
5144: 
5145: **Large ρ** (global backbone, $\rho \sim \text{diam}(\mathcal{X})$):
5146: - ✓ **Pros**: Uniform derivative bounds, stable high-order behavior, larger time steps
5147: - ✗ **Cons**: Loses geometric information, weak adaptation, reverts to global statistics
5148: 
5149: **Optimal choice** (depends on application):
5150: - **Exploration phase** (early optimization): Large ρ for stability
5151: - **Exploitation phase** (near optima): Small ρ for geometric adaptation
5152: - **Adaptive schedule**: $\rho(t) = \rho_0 \cdot e^{-\gamma t}$ (annealing from global to local)
